name: hake, capture by trawler and landing whole, fresh | landed hake, fresh | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/17584/documentation

This activity represents capture and landing of the demersal hake (Merluccius spp.) by mid-water and bottom trawling. The life cycle inventories were produced based on representative samples from Peru, Spain and Namibia. The activity may be used as proxy for other hake trawling activities. ;System boundaries and relation between activities

From the vessel use (including landing) and maintenance phases, including all upstream activities



A subdivision of the system between different species was assumed between hake and the other demersal or pelagic species landed. It should be noted that economic value of fish can be variable from a seasonal perspective.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/031:Fishing/0311:Marine fishing

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data corresponds to the landings-weighted average for operations in several hake fisheries between 2006 and 2011.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Miscellanea hake species caught and landed through trawling.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Mid-water or bottom trawling, fish conservation with ice.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The dataset is an average from the regional datasets of Namibia, Peru and Spain. The relative (to their sum) production volume is used as weighting key to extract a weighted average Global dataset. The weights used are the following: 36%, 7% and 57% for Spain, Namibia and Peru respectively.

exchanges.description: Construction of a trawler, per 1000 kg of light ship weight (LSW). Regressions based on mainly primary data were created to relate the weight of each inventory item to a trawler's LSW. The list of inventory items (granularity) contribute >95% of environmental impacts, as described in the reference publication.
